text: hey guys this is Alex thanks for
clicking and welcome to this lesson on
could and should now these are two of
the most common words in the English
language so if you're wondering how we
use them what situations we use them
this is a lesson for you so we have an
example conversation here we have James
and Rebecca having a conversation
now James says I'm going to the movies
what is the difference if Rebecca says
you could walk versus you should walk
hmm so if Rebecca says you could walk
she is offering a suggestion she is
offering a possibility then she says you
should walk if you have watched past
lessons on giving advice in English
should is stronger
it gives definite advice okay so we use
could for suggestions or possibilities
you
okay suggestions and possibilities so
again you could walk or you could take
the bus one or the other
okay you should gives definite advice
you should walk gives definite advice
okay now using tuna and should you can
talk about future possibility or advice
for the future you can also use it to
talk about the past as well okay so it's
like giving hindsight advice those of
you who are not familiar with hindsight
I recommend looking it up in the
dictionary but hindsight essentially is
looking back at something you did in the
past and thinking about something you
could have done differently or something
you should have done differently so if
you are hearing me speak you heard me
say you could have done something
differently or you should have done
something differently okay so if you've
watched the lesson on engvid about the
past form of should could is the same
now remember we can say you should have
studied right advisability in the past
if we say you could have studied so it
was a possibility it was a suggestion
you know you could have done that so
again if depending on which one you want
to use you are either making a
suggestion or giving one possibility or
you are giving definite advice strong
advice okay so just remember that should
is much stronger than good and they both
talk can be used to talk about future
possibility so for example what are you
doing this weekend I could visit my
parents okay so it's possible that I am
going to visit my parents versus I
should visit my parents I have not seen
them in a long time it's a good idea for
me to visit my parents okay so if you
